security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown with Java code templates for error handling. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or filesystem access. Contains no security concerns.

content.value_statement: Inconsistent error handling creates confusion for users and developers. This skill provides standardized exception classes, error response formats, and global exception handlers for Java Spring applications.
actual_capabilities: Design ErrorResponse DTO with consistent format
Apply logging strategy with appropriate log levels
Handle validation errors from Bean Validation
limitations: Does not execute code or modify existing files
No database integration or ORM support
Error codes and messages require manual customization

use_cases.title: Set up error handling
use_cases.description: Establish consistent error handling patterns across a new Java Spring Boot project

use_cases.title: Create error responses
use_cases.description: Design standardized error response formats for REST API endpoints

use_cases.title: Enforce coding standards
use_cases.description: Provide team with reusable exception classes and exception handling guidelines

prompt_templates.title: Basic exception class
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom exception class for [entity] not found. Use the BusinessException base class from allra-error-handling skill.

prompt_templates.title: Global exception handler
prompt_templates.prompt: Implement a GlobalExceptionHandler using @RestControllerAdvice that handles BusinessException and MethodArgumentNotValidException.

prompt_templates.title: Error response DTO
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an ErrorResponse record with code, message, errors list, and timestamp fields. Include static factory methods for different error scenarios.

prompt_templates.title: Service layer validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a service method that validates business rules, throws appropriate domain exceptions like DuplicateResourceException or ForbiddenException, and includes proper logging.

best_practices: Use BusinessException as base class for all domain exceptions
Log business exceptions at WARN level and system exceptions at ERROR level
Exclude sensitive data (passwords, tokens) from error responses and logs
anti_patterns: Throwing generic Exception instead of specific business exceptions
Returning different error response structures for different endpoints
Including stack traces or internal details in API error responses

faq.question: Which Java versions are supported?
faq.answer: The code uses Java 17+ features like records. Works with Spring Boot 3.x and Java 17 or higher.

faq.question: What is the maximum number of custom exceptions?
faq.answer: No limit. Create as many domain-specific exceptions as needed following the BusinessException pattern.

faq.question: How do I integrate with existing exception handlers?
faq.answer: Add @RestControllerAdvice and @ExceptionHandler methods. Ensure no conflicting handlers exist in the same package scope.

faq.question: Is my error data stored or logged externally?
faq.answer: This skill only generates code templates. No data is collected, stored, or sent anywhere.

faq.question: My error responses show different formats. How do I fix this?
faq.answer: Use the ErrorResponse record consistently across all controllers. All endpoints should return the same structure.

faq.question: How does this compare to Spring's default error handling?
faq.answer: Provides custom business exception handling with domain-specific error codes. More flexible than Spring's default error responses.
